path: answers-db/books/Understanding Analysis/2. Sequences and Series/2.4 The Monotone Convergence Theorem and a First Look at Infinite Series/2.4.4/b

attr.q: Use the Monotone Convergence Theorem to supply a proof for the Nested Interval Property (Theorem 1.4.1) that doesn't make use of AoC.
attr.a:
Just substitute the part

The set A has every b_n as upper bounds therefore, by AoC, supermum exists.

to

The sequence A has every b_n as upper bounds therefore, by Monotone Convergence Theorem, supermum exists.
